intro: Cleghornia dongnaiensis, commonly known as the Dong Nai cleghornia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight hairy texture. Due to habitat loss, Cleghornia dongnaiensis is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
